1.title: Meet the Guys

11.content:
Dean had his daily routine. He'd wake up at 6:30, go to the gym down the block, come home grab something healthy to eat and change into work clothes, and head to work. He'd done this for as long as he could remember, since he started his job two years ago. His regimented routine showed, he was easily the most fit and well-groomed of his roommates and most of his friends.

Lately however, things were changing. Dean had been promoted recently at his financial firm. He was pleased with the money but the demands were disrupting his lifestyle. Late nights at the office and having to entertain clients over extravagant food and drinks were catching up to Dean. Instead of early morning gym sessions, he'd be having late night pizza sessions.

On top of his work demands, Dean was stressed about his little brother Zach who had moved in and had a difficult time finding a job. He was constantly having to treat Zach to meals and keep him motivated.

But Dean was running out of steam and it showed. His active lifestyle had been slowly become more sedentary. A few extra pounds of fat had made their way to his waistline. In fact, Dean outweighed his brother Zach for the first time since they were in high school. Dean was too focused on his work to even really notice however.

"Fuck!" Dean shouted as he woke up, his alarm having went off an hour ago. He was in his boxers, and had apparently passed out with Chinese food in hand. His vision was a little blurry from the several drinks he had over dinner, trying to wine and dine potential clients. When he was with clients, he had to be a "yes" man and doing whatever his clients asked of him, even if that meant taking far too many shots last night.

Dean stumbled across the room, grabbing a towel so he could get in a quick shower to wash off the sweat and shame. He comes out to the living room to see...
11.title: Dean

choices: "Your client accepted. I want to speak to you about a promotion."
"I need you to hire a new assistant."
111.content:
Zach was there, wearing next to nothing as usual, sitting on the couch watching television. Frankly Dean was surprised to his brother awake. Zach had his computer open, Dean hoped perhaps he was looking for a job, he had hoped. As much as he wanted to help his little brother out, he didn't have the time recently.

"Sup, bro?" Zach said as he saw his older brother stumble out of the room. Dean groaned in response, from his hangover and knowing he was running late.

Zach got up and walked over to his brother, as if to say or do something important. He gave his brother's little budding belly a shake. Dean was still pretty solid with muscle but there was some slight movement when he shook his brother's bloated gut. Dean shook Zach off of him. "Stop that, what are you doing?"

"Woah, when did that happen?" Zach replied. He was used to Dean being an obsessive gym rat and being told he was a lazy slob. Zach wasn't the trimmest either but given the lectures from his brother about health and nutrition and the gym it all seemed a bit ironic.

"It's nothing, I've just been too busy for the gym recently," Dean replied defensively. "Anyways I've got to get going to work."

Zach just shrugged. He peered into Dean's room as he went into the bathroom to shower and saw the leftover containers. He smiled, knowing his brother was trying to hide his bad eating habits out of fear of being seen as a hypocrite. As he was in his brothers room, he saw his phone ringing. It was Dean's office. Zach figured it was probably important, so he answered it.

"Hello?" Zach answered, not knowing what else to say. Maybe they'd think he was Dean. Zach had a lower voice but it wasn't that different.

It was Dean's boss, Erica Danvers. "Dean," she began. Zach was right, she thought it was his brother on the phone. "I need you to come in right away..."
111.title: Zach

choices: “We’ve decided your firm is the right choice for us.”
“We’re going to go in another direction. I’m sorry.”
“How would you like to take us out tonight? We’re still undecided.”
114.content:
“Well well well, look who finally woke up,” Dean’s coworker, Travis, said as he sat at Dean’s kitchen table having a cup of coffee, looking particularly smug.

“Travis? What are you doing here?” Dean asked.

Dean motioned over to Zach who was sitting on the couch eating cereal. “He let me in.” Zach just shrugged and look back at the television.

“Okay but why are you here?” Dean continued. He realized he was only in his underwear and as his body wasn’t quite in peak shape, so he threw a t-shirt on.

Travis chuckled. “Ms. Danvers sent me. She wanted to know about how last night went and why you were late today,” Travis smirked, taking another sip of coffee.

Dean rolled his eyes. While Travis and he worked for the same company, they were rivals. Both had the same job and essentially had to woo clients nightly. Dean was given a shot with one last night and Travis was far too eager to brown nose the boss and find out how it went for himself.

“It went well. They’re going to go over the numbers and come in with a decision today,” Dean said. “Now if you don’t mind, I’m going to shower. I’ll see you at the office.”

“Sure, I’ll get out of here,” Travis said finishing off the cup of coffee and standing up from the table. He walked over towards Dean.

“Been skipping the gym lately, have we?” Travis said as he passed Dean, and gave his very slight belly a poke.

Dean gave Travis no credit but he sure knew how to get under his skin. After all, Dean was typically the fittest guy in the room. He knew he’d drifted lately but it wasn’t as if he was some fat slob. At most he’d put on five to ten pounds and it’s not as if his muscles had gone anywhere. Like skinny Travis had anything to brag about anyways.

Travis left and Dean proceeded to get ready for work. If he had time for a protein shake he’d have made one but he was already hours late, and his clients were coming in this morning.

Dean arrived to the office and saw his clients already there. “Shit,” he thought to himself. It was all ironic since the reason he was late and hungover was because of his raucous clients.

Dean saw his boss, Ms. Danvers sitting with the clients in the conference room. He was anxious and trying to read their body language. He saw a doughnut sitting out in the break area and had to have one to calm his nerves. He took a gulp and a deep breath and made his way in.

“Nice of your to join us, Mr. Prescott,” Ms. Danvers said rather formally. She usually called him Dean. He took a seat and just slashed that winning sales smile that he usually saved for the clients and dates.

The client, Andrew, an older fellow, and his younger business partner Len, sat there without much expression on their faces.

“Well Dean...,” Andrew began. Dean took a deep breath.
114.title: His coworker

1141.content:
Dean just smiled. All the work he had put into getting this account would pay off. He got up to shake hands and thank his clients. Ms. Danvers watched Dean and gave him a look of affirmation..

“Shall we celebrate?” Len said, hinting that they should get some drinks.

Dean looked to his boss for the decision. “You go ahead. I’ve got some work to do around here, but Dean why don’t you take our new clients somewhere nice for lunch and drinks. Maybe the all you can eat sushi restaurant in midtown,” she replied.

“Sounds like my kinda place,” Len said patting his belly.

He wasn’t fat by any means but there was no denying Len had a bit of a beer gut, likely from his college and then a few years post. Len and Andrew worked for a beer distributor, so perhaps Len had a few too many beers, Dean thought. Len was mid twenties, probably the same age as Dean. He had a bit of a southern accent and a rugged somehow permanent five-o-clock shadow to go with his short light brown hair. Andrew was about twenty years older, clearly the more mature of the team and more of the business type, to contrast with Len’s frat boy attitude.

“Dean before you go, I’d like to see you for just a moment,” Ms. Danvers finished.

Dean followed Erica Danvers to her office, worried about what she might have to say. “Good work,” she began as he sat across from her. “That’s your third client this month. Your outpacing Travis. I’m going to put in for a raise for you. Keep up the good work. Take the rest of the day to keep those two happy. Make sure you charge everything to the company card,” she reminded him.

Dean walked out of his bosses office feeling pleased. He saw Travis at his desk on his way to reconvene with his clients. It was clear he had been keeping a close eye on Dean and was not pleased to see him so successful. Dean walked by confidently, puffing out his chest as he passed by Travis’ desk.

“Have a good rest of the day, Travis,” Dean said, attempting to irk Travis, as he gathered his belongings. Travis just mumbled under his breath in response.

Dean and his new clients left for the all you can eat sushi restaurant. Sushi, sake, appetizers, and lots of it was served to the three men as they overindulged and enjoyed their afternoon.

“Think I could go for another round,” Len said confidently.

“You’re a bottomless pit, Len. I’m not sure where you put it all,” Andrew joked. Dean wondered if Andrew was just being polite because Len did have a bit of a gut, he thought.

Len grabbed a handful of belly through his shirt. “Right here, bro,” he laughed.

Andrew just smiled and began to gather his jackets. “Alright kids, I think it’s time I get out of here. You two enjoy the rest of the day. And you,” Andrew said looking at Len, “try to get in before noon tomorrow.”

Len just laughed and sipped some of his sake. Andrew left and Dean caught Len rubbing his stomach.

“So, another round of everything?” Len said as Andre departed. Len had a shit-eating grin on his face. Dean thought about abusing the company card, and his raise, and Erica telling him to do whatever he needs to keep the clients happy.

“Sure man let’s do it,” Dean said as he flagged down a waitress.

“Let’s make a bit of a wager, see who can eat more,” Len said, with a toothpick in his mouth trying to look cool.

Dean was intrigued despite being full. “Alright what are the stakes?”

“Winner picks where we go next. And if I win, your paying. Or your company is,” Len said confidently.

Dean nodded his head and put out his hand to shake Len’s.

“You’re goin’ down, city boy,” Len said playfully. It was pretty clear from his accent Len was from Texas or Louisiana, Dean thought.

The food and drinks were served. Several plates of sushi, spring rolls, soups, salads, dumplings, and much more, along with another bottle of sake. The two men stared each other down ready to face off.
1141.title: “We’ve decided your firm is the right choic...

11412.content:
Dean tried to keep up, he really did, but Len was clearly a bottomless pit as Andrew had suggested and out ate Dean. In fact, he kept going to just be a prick, but Dean knew it was playful, and he had to keep his client happy.

"Well done, you win," Dean said, leaning back to show his bloated belly. Len finished off the last of his beverage and smirked in response. Dean looked at his watch, somehow it was only 5:00 despite what felt like hours of overindulgence.

"So, where are we going tonight then? You get to choose," Dean said. He knew Len knew that Dean and his company would be paying for whatever it was they did.

Len confidently jiggled his belly and gave a ponderous look. Dean could see some of it through the holes in his dress shirt. It was pale and fairly hairy, the same medium brown hair that adorned his head and face. Dean thought a couple of the buttons look almost ready to burst. Surely, this shirt Len wore was not one for the long haul the way Len put it away. Dean's clothes were looking tight themselves. He thought maybe he should go home and change before they made any plans for where to go.

"I'm thinkin' on it. Let me text a few people to see what's goin' on tonight," Len said. He let out a big burp to punctuate his sentence.

Dean shifted his weight and realized he need to put on something else. Not only was he in his work clothes but they were pinching at his growing tummy in a way that was uncomfortable. Surely they could dress more casual for whatever Len had in mind.

"Why don't we stop off at mine? We can grab a few drinks there to pregame and I can get out of these clothes," he gestured, indicating his lack of breathing room.

"Alright, that sounds good man," Len said. The two got up and made their way toward Dean's apartment. When they arrived someone was in the apartment.
11412.title: Len wins.

114122.content:
Alec was sitting on the couch, with a beer in his hand as the two walked in. He was wearing a black wife beater that was probably a bit too tight. Both Dean and Len were already fairly drunk from the sake and simultaneously in a food coma. "Hey hey," Alec said as they entered.

Dean stumbled in first, looking slightly disheveled. He plopped himself down on the chair beside Alec. Len followed Dean in and did the same. As he did one of his buttons finally flung off his dress shirt and into the abyss of the guys apartment. "Oh shit," Len said, laughing. "Guess maybe be overdid it," he said slapping his gut, ripples going through the little amount of exposed flesh.

"You guys had quite a day huh?" Alec said remarking on the fact that the two were clearly intoxicated, not that he had any issue with it.

"For sure," Dean said, groaning and holding his gut in discomfort. "Shit I need to change before my buttons come off," Dean said. "So Len where are we going?"

"I know this club we should go to. I have some friends that are headin' that way. Y'all should come too man," Len gestured to Alec.

Alec shrugged, seeming to be fine with it. "Maybe our other roommates will want to come too," he suggested. It was a Friday night after all.

"I may need to borrow a shirt though, bro," Len said fidgeting with the hole in his shirt.

"Sure man," Alec said. He looked Len up and down and figured he could fit into his clothes. Len might be a little bigger in the gut but Alec was wider all throughout, so it would probably be fine. Alec got up off the couch to go look for something Len could wear.

Alec returned with a couple shirts for Len to check out. He picked one of the roomier button downs he had, hoping Len's middle could fit into it, but because of his profession he didn't have too many dress shirts to choose from. "Why don't you give this one a try?" he suggested, walking over to Len.

Len stood up, still drunk and in the mood to have some fun, ripped the entire button down he was wearing off, sending buttons flying and his moobs and gut jiggling. Dean hoped one of Alec's shirts would fit him, since he had completely destroyed the one he had worn over.

Both Dean and Alec got an eyeful of this guy that they didn't even know very well. He certainly wasn't fat, but had a college gain and then some. He was a pretty hairy guy, covered in brown hair. There were a couple of evident stretch marks on his sides and gut indicating that his gain may have been somewhat recent or quick. Len laughed and gave himself another belly slap, he clearly was proud or at least not ashamed of his size.

Len then tried on Alec's shirts one by one and...
114122.title: Alec

1141221.content:
“Well fuck man, maybe I do need to lay off the burritos,” Len said giving his gut a playful pat as he threw Alec’s last dress shirt to the ground. He’d tried on them all and each one was too tight around the middle. Alec was a big guy so it was impressive but they were too different of body types. Alex was muscular and big all over whereas Len wasn’t quite as stocky and had a beer belly that was not agreeing with Alec’s clothes.

“I’m the biggest guy here so. Not sure what you’re gonna do,” Alec replied picking up his shirts and folding them.

“Not anymore you’re not,” Len said jiggling his gut and showing it off. Dean chuckled as he watched Len sit on the couch and grab a beer.

“So what should we do?” Dean asked. “I’m not sure that you’ll get in anywhere without a shirt,” he said stating the obvious.

“There’s a thrift shop down the street. I guess someone could go get him something that fits,” Alec suggested. Len let out a burp.

“That’d be dope man. Could one of you go? Obviously I can’t run out like this,” he said looking down and pointing to his exposed flesh.

Alec and Dean looked at each other, figuring out who would go.
1141221.title: they were all too tight.

11412211.content:
"I'll go get something for you, no worries," Dean volunteered. Despite the fact that they were just hanging out, he knew he had to keep his clients entertained, regardless of whatever it was they wanted. It came with the territory. Somehow that involved getting a shirt for his stuffed client so that they could go out to a party.

"Thanks man," Len said as he slouched down onto the sofa, his belly jiggling in the process. Alec sat beside him and cracked open fresh beers for them both.

Dean left the apartment and headed to the store and picked up a few options of shirts, he didn't want to end up getting the wrong size and having to run back. Surely he couldn't relate to what size Len must wear. Dean even managed to get a spare shirt for himself. The one he had been wearing was a bit snug from all the food he'd eaten earlier.

Within the hour he returned to the apartment to see...
11412211.title: Dean goes.

1142.content:
Dean sighed and put his head down. He was devastated. All of his hard work with the client was for nothing. He caught his bosses eye who gave a disapproving look. The prospective clients shook hands and left the building. Dean’s boss, Erica, asked him to stay behind for a minute.

“Are you sure you’re up to this, Dean?” she asked with concern. “Since you’ve started in this role you’ve not exactly been hitting it out of the park.”

“I am,” he replied confidently. The look in his eye was not conveying that though. He caught a glimpse of Travis who was very closely watching the meeting from a distance.

“I’m sorry, it’s just been difficult transitioning. I’ll get the hang of it, I promise,” he continued. Dean had only started this role of bringing in potential clients for new business recently. It was clear it had been hard for him, given his lack of sleep, exercise and good habits. Even his boss couldn’t help but notice he’d put on about ten pounds, not exactly filling her with confidence about Dean’s ability to handle the excess stress.

“I’m going to have Travis handle new accounts for a while. Prove to me you can get back on top of your game and I’ll give you another shot,” she said after some consideration.

Dean nodded his head. He was not pleased. While this would give him more time to focus on himself, he liked the promotion obviously for the money and the trust that was put in him. He wanted his boss to be impressed. And worse of all, he knew how smug Travis would be to hear that Dean struck out and that he’d be solely in charge of accounts for a while. Dean went back to his desk, mumbling under his breath.

He watched as Travis was called into the conference room and was told he’d be in charge of clients for the time being. When he left, he could see the giant smile on Travis face. It angered Dean immensely.

“Guess you couldn’t handle it in the big leagues, eh Dean?” Travis said walking over with a doughnut in hand. He chewed it in a way that annoyed Dean, though everything Travis did rubbed Dean the wrong way. He just looked at his computer screen and ignored Travis. “Maybe if I’m generous I’ll take you out to lunch one of these days. If I have the time between meeting clients, that is.”

Travis walked off, and eventually was whisked off to some client meetings. Dean had no choice but to keep his head down and do his work. He wanted another shot and to show Erica that he was better than Travis.

After a month...
1142.title: “We’re going to go in another direction. Iâ...

choices: Dean finishes the report on time.
Dean doesn't finish the report on time.
11422.content:
Dean got back into his routine. Since he wasn't busy entertaining clients constantly, he worked off the excess weight with ease, and had event began building more muscle than before. He was feeling strong and good. Despite having lost his promotion, he couldn't complain. Sure, he had felt a bit like a failure, but maybe it was a good thing. Maybe the client work wasn't for him. He was happy to take any opportunity that came his way, but as ambitious as he was, he was feeling happier and more himself.

He sat at his desk with headphones in as he heard footsteps approaching. It was Travis, his arch-nemesis. They'd been getting along somewhat better since they were not competing for their position, but there was still some bad blood between them. Travis always enjoying giving Dean a hard time, and Dean was happy to give it back.

"I'm going to need that report by Thursday, Dean. I've got drinks with the heads of Montgomery Inc. on Friday," Travis demanded with a confident grin on his face. Travis loved asking Dean to do things. Dean just grinned and took it for the most part, but Travis wasn't his boss.

Dean rolled his eyes. "Sure thing, big guy," he replied. Dean had been playfully making jabs at Travis' weight. It was almost ironic since Travis had poked fun at Dean when he had put on a few pounds. Now that Dean was in great shape, he had to give Travis a taste of his own medicine. It was clear Travis had gained around 20 pounds in the last month. He was formerly a skinny guy. But the constant client meetings and change of lifestyle was not agreeing with Travis' waistline. Travis was wearing a dress shirt with buttons that were clearly straining to contain all of his new pounds. Travis was about 6'0" with slicked back light brown hair. Dean couldn't help but notice his face had been looking a little fuller and his dress clothes showed off his growing curves. He wondered if this trend would continue.

Travis either pretended he didn't hear the 'big guy' comment or didn't take note as he walked back to his desk. Dean couldn't help but notice the way he butt filled out his pants. He envisioned what Travis would look like even bigger.

Dean shook himself out of his lost focus and back toward his work. He sighed, the report Travis asked for wasn't nearly ready. It was Monday so he'd only had a few days to get it together.
11422.title: Travis has put on weight.

choices: "This is the sign of success, little guy," Travis said jiggling his gut.
"You think I'm fat?" Travis asked, angrily.
114222.content:
"WHAT THE FUCK DO YOU MEAN IT'S NOT READY?!" Travis shouted from his cell phone to Dean, who was at the office. Dean thought about the fact that maybe he could've worked harder to get it done in time, but he also was kind of enjoying seeing or hearing in this case, Travis pissed off. Travis was out with clients, as usual, while Dean was burning the midnight oil in the office. He had given the report plenty of time and attention, but it was a big ask to get it done this quickly.

"I'm sorry Travis, it's just, I'm not going to be able to finish in time for your meeting at this rate," Dean said honestly. He was alone in the office at this point so he had his feet up and was sipping on a beer. "I'll see what I can get done in the next few hours, but I've got to get out of here at some point."

"Fuck, Dean," he heard Travis let out a sigh. "Okay, listen. I'm going to wrap up this client meeting and then come in and work on this with you. I've got to have this done by noon tomorrow, that's when I'm meeting with the client and getting drinks and lunch with them."

Dean was surprised at how quickly Travis calmed down. Spending his Thursday night in the office with Travis didn't sound ideal, but it's the only option he had at this point. He risked getting called out by Travis and his boss taking action if he flat out refused. He agreed to Travis' idea and hung up. He got back to working on the report and waited for Travis to get to the office.

About an hour later, Dean heard the elevator door ding. It was Travis. He looked like maybe he'd had a few drinks, his tie was loose and he looked less uptight than usual. He walked into the office as Dean awaited a scolding, but Travis was unusually calm.

"Alright Dean, catch me up. Where are we at?" Travis said walking over to Dean's desk and leaning down looking at what Dean had on the computer. Dean couldn't help but notice some pudge squeezing above Travis' belt buckle as he leaned over. Dean took his focus away from Travis' little belly and toward the computer. He showed Travis where the report was and the issues he was having with completing it.

Travis let out a sigh. "Looks like this is going to be an all-nighter, huh?" Dean nodded his head, annoyed but knowing that Travis was correct that it was going to take hours to complete this, even together.

"Fine, let's do this. I need to order something to eat though, I'm starving," Travis said holding his stomach. "You want something?'

Dean shrugged. "Pizza would be cool, I guess," he said. "Weren't you at dinner with clients?"

"Psh. You know how it is, you do more talking than eating," Travis said, dialing on his phone. Dean heard Travis start ordering on the phone. He called the local place they usually ordered from. Travis ordered two pizzas, two orders of fries, a cheesesteak sub, chicken wings, and sodas.

"Is someone else coming?" Dean asked when Travis finished on the phone. Travis gave him a puzzled look. "It's just, that's kind of a lot of food."

"We're going to be here all night dude, we'll get hungry," Travis said. "Get off my ass would you?" he said snidely. Dean just gave a look and got back to the report. Shortly after the food came and Travis started to dig in. Dean just watched as his coworker gorged himself like he'd never eaten before. Dean had a couple slices of pizza and a few handfuls of fries but wanted to see how much Travis would eat if he left it. He wasn't all that hungry anyways. Slowly but surely Travis made his way through one full pizza, all of the wings, half of the sub and most of the fries. He'd also drank most of first two Liter soda bottle. He was kind of intrigued and impressed. Travis tried to stifle a belch but couldn't help but let it slip.

"Dude," Dean said in response. "Dude what?" Travis said with an annoyed face. He had wing sauce on his face and his shirt. They both looked back down at the print out they were reviewing and tried to avoid having much conversation. Surely but slowly Travis kept eating away at what remained.

"Are you going to eat the rest of your pizza?" Travis said. Dean was kind of impressed that he had the balls to ask. "Go ahead, big guy," Dean replied.

"You keep calling me, big guy," Travis stated after scarfing down some pizza. Dean nodded. "Yeah it's just, you've put on some weight Trav."

Travis gave Dean a smirk. He looked down at his stomach which was undeniably pooched over his too-tight belt. Dean can't believe he hadn't already removed it after the gorging he'd been doing for the last hour or two.
114222.title: Dean doesn't finish the report on time.

choices: Dean puts his hand on Travis' gut in admiration.
"Wow, I guess you really are the big man of the company now."
"Wow, you've become such a fat pig."
1142221.content:
Dean glared at Travis, jiggling his gut with pride. He supposed being called 'little guy' was appropriate given that he'd been calling Travis just the opposite. He recalled when Travis picked on him for having put on a few before his promotion was taken away. Now that Travis had responsibility over all the client work he was embracing his extra pounds. Dean considered paying back the cruelty comments, thought it wasn't particularly his style.

Dean thought about all Travis had put him through, having been an asshole all of the time and constantly competing to be the bigger man at the company. Now, he was, figuratively and literally. He thought of how to react. Something about Travis' new gut was appealing to him. He considered his response carefully.
1142221.title: "This is the sign of success, little guy,...

choices: Hit up a bar or two
Ask Alec if he can help him at the construction site
12.content:
It was a Thursday morning. Zach had fallen asleep on the couch last night and woke up to his roommates heading off to work. He was on the couch, shirtless, sprawled out for all the world to see. Zach had recently moved into the apartment with his brother Dean. Their former roommate left, and Zach was growing tired of living at home in Jersey with his parents. So, Dean offered the room up to his little bro.

After graduating college, he'd had some trouble finding work. He'd studied Computer Science but it was hard finding work in such an oversaturated field.

Zach had been living in the Manhattan apartment for six weeks, but still had no luck finding work. Needless to say, he was not really able to afford much. Dean was kind enough to help him out, treat him to dinner or a beer once in a while, or quite frequently. Zach would snack on all of the food in the apartment when the boys were at work. And it showed. Zach had gained about five to ten pounds, it seemed.

Alec and Jared were starting to get a little tired of Zach mooching off of their food and drinks. Not to mention the fact that he lazed around the apartment and did whatever he wanted, whether it was watching television or playing video games all hours of the night. Occasionally he'd have friends or girls over late into the night when the guys had to work in the morning. The mess he left behind was starting to irk them as well: food wrappers, empty beer cans, his bong. Finding him shirtless in the couch, often hungover, was becoming a regular occurrence.

"Mornin' bro," Dean commented as he walked by a shirtless Zach, dressed in his work attire. Dean was drinking a protein shake he'd just made.

Zach groaned and put the pillow over his head. Jared walked into the room, also dressed for work, and just rolled his eyes looking down at Zach and the mess he had made. "You might want to lay off the beer dude," he said poking at Zach's furry stomach, that was starting to look a little bigger.

"Stop that!" Zach said. He removed pillow off of his head in anger.

"Don't sleep out here if you don't want us to mess with you," Jared smirked.

"He's right, bro. You should clean this up today," Dean said pointing to the beers and pizza crusts on the floor beside the couch. "We don't want to get mice," he continued.

"Yeah, yeah," Zach said getting up from the couch. He was clad only in boxer briefs and his expanding butt was on full display as was his morning wood.

"Woah, you happy to see me?" Alec joked as he walked in the living room, referring to Zach's hard-on. He'd just gotten out of the shower and was wrapped in a towel. "You know it," Zach laughed as he rummaged through the pantries for a box of cereal.

Dean and Jared were about to head out for the day. "Any interviews today, Zach?" Jared asked, somewhat sarcastically.

Zach had sat back on the couch with a hearty bowl of Lucky Charms in whole milk prepared. He just groaned and continued eating as he looked for something on television.

"Keep checking those job sites I sent you, bro," Dean said, trying to encourage his brother as he patted him on his shoulder. He headed for the door and smiled, along with Jared who took the same train as Dean most mornings. "At least please don't eat us out of house and home, man," Jared quipped with a smile. Zach rolled his eyes.

"Later," Zach said as they both left. He continued eating a few more helpings of Lucky Charms as Alec got dressed and headed off to work.

What does Zach do?
12.title: Zach

choices: A girl sits beside him and they start chatting
121.content:
Once everyone left the apartment Zach breathed a sigh of relief. He didn't mind his roommates, in fact he loved them, but he was getting the feeling that they were all growing tired of his routine. He wasn't completely unaware that he'd been taking advantage of the food, the beer, and everything else that his roommates were providing him. He didn't mind so much when it came to Dean, he was his brother, but he knew that Alec and Jared especially were hoping things would change soon.

Zach was feeling somewhat hungover. He recalls having had drinks with some friends last night and then coming back with a large pizza and playing video games until the wee hours of the morning. He might have also dug into the beer stash. That much was a given based on the empty beer cans scattered across the floor.

"Shower time," he said to himself after catching a whiff of his body odor. He tended to sweat in his sleep most nights, especially when he crashed in the living room since they didn't have an air conditioner out there.

Zach stripped out of his boxers and stepped into a cool shower. He knew his roommates were gone for the day, so he felt perfectly comfortable strutting around the apartment naked. Once he was out of the shower and the steam cleared from the mirror, he caught a glimpse of himself, in all his glory. He looked down at his fuzzy gut that Jared had poked earlier. He certainly wasn't fat but he was maybe a little softer than he was when he moved to the city.

Maybe his gut was a little bigger, Zach thought, but he didn't seem to care or mind. "As long as I can still see my dick," Zach joked to himself. He knew he was a long way off from that, especially since he considered himself to be pretty well endowed.

It was honestly the first time that he even had the thought that perhaps he'd put on a few pounds after Jared said something this morning. Zach shrugged it off, threw on some clothes, and grabbed his bag to head off to a local coffee shop.

Zach had been spending a lot of time in the apartment recently and needed to get out to get in a decent headspace to actually sit down and apply for jobs. He got a coffee and a few pastries from the place, and took a seat. Opening his laptop, he began looking at some of the stuff his brother had sent him. Zach had studied Computer Science, so ideally he'd find some IT work he could do. He'd never had a desk job before so the idea was completely unfamiliar to him. He wasn't sure that it was for him but he might as well put his studies to good use.

What happens?
121.title: Look for jobs

choices: After few weeks at the new job.
1212.content:
Zach looked up from his computer screen, considering order more pastries after he ate the ones he'd already ordered. "It's kind of expensive though," he thought to himself, trying to dissuade himself. He was still hungry though, even after the previous pastries and heaping bowls bowls of cereal back at the apartment.

He decided he wasn't going to stop himself, it's why he had a credit card after all - to pay for things when he couldn't afford them. Zach walked up to the register to order and saw the 'Now Hiring' sign just beside the register. It wasn't exactly a dream job but it's been hard for him to find work in his field, so why not work at the coffee shop? It's close to home, and maybe I'll get free pastries, he thought.

A woman behind the register with a dirty blonde hair and tattoos approached. "More danish, or you looking for something else?" she asked.

"Uh," Zach stammered for a second. "I actually was going to ask about the job. Can I apply?"

The woman seemed sort of surprised. This wasn't the first time she'd seen Zach in the shop and the sign had been posted for some time. "Well, I'm the manager so I can make that happen for you," she said bluntly.

"Oh, cool. Well, I'm interested, so," Zach began nervously. He was caught off guard by her candidness. Not to mention the fact that he thought the woman was cute but he was trying to not come off like a douche, especially if he was hoping she'd hire him.

"Have you worked at a place like this? What makes you think you'd be any good at it?" she said slyly.

"Well I used to work at the snack stand at my pool growing up. Same sort of think, I imagine," Zach said. He was very casual but something about him was very charming.

"You know what? You're hired. You seem like a good dude and you seem like you need this," she says. "I'm April, by the way."

"Sick, really?" Zach was shocked. He couldn't wait to tell his roommates he had a job, maybe they'd stop giving him such a hard time. "When do I start?" he asked scratching his head.

"Tomorrow," April says. "I'll have one of the guys train you," she finished. She tucked her hair behind her ear and smiled. Zach smiled back, the genuine excitement beaming from his face. It wasn't his dream job but hey, he finally had a job in New York City.

Where to?
1212.title: The coffee shop is hiring

12123.content:
"Shit shit shit," Zach whispered to himself as he fumbled with the buttons on his work shirt. It was a dress shirt that wore often. He had a few of them, because god knows he wasn't too good at laundry.

He was already running late and now he was having shirt problems. Zach was perplexed, this shirt fit the other day but he was having problems with the buttons this morning. He figured it was just a fat day, but the truth is it has been a part of a pattern. After three weeks of his new job, the pastries were adding to his waistline. Not to mention the fact that he only worked three days a week and still had his evenings and nights to do whatever he'd like with. He'd made some new work friends that he'd go drinking with nearly every work day.

Dean and Jared were in the other room getting ready for work as well. They always started fairly early but Zach was usually out of the house before them since he worked earlier and got off earlier. "Problem, bud?" Jared asked as he heard a frustrated Zach in front of the bathroom mirror. Jared was sipping a coffee and taking his time. He was an early riser and almost always awake before Zach despite him going to work later. He was entertained every morning watching Zach stumble out of bed and run off to the coffee shop, a job he just started and was still often late for. He's lucky he has friends that cover for him and that his manager liked him.

Zach got the buttons fastened and smiled looking at himself in the bathroom mirror. He gave his beard and his hair a once-over with a comb and headed out to the living room. "All is good," Zach said giving a thumbs up to Dean and Jared who were sitting at the kitchen table.

Zach eyed some doughnuts on the table and went in to grab a few. "You get all the snacks you want at work, why do you need these?" Dean quipped. Zach had a mouthful of doughnut and didn't respond right away.

"I don't know I'm hungry," he said in response, talking through the chewing of his second doughnut.

Just then the stress of Zach's growing gut gave way and bounced a troublesome button off his shirt. They had already been stretched to their limit to so it was a matter of time. Jared just laughed hysterically in response.

"Fuck. My other shirts are dirty," Zach said looking down at his shirt which was exposing some flabby, hairy flesh.

"Think that maybe this is a sign you maybe need to lay off the pastries?" Dean said, in the most encouraging way that he could.

Jared just scoffed, knowing Zach was incapable of laying off any food or drink, especially recently. He doesn't recall having seen him in the apartment without one of the two in hand.

Zach poked his flabby gut. It was clear he'd gained another ten pounds or so since starting the job. At least it was clear to everyone around him, while Zach remained fairly oblivious. If he did realize it, he certainly didn't care.

"Thanks, that's helpful bro. I can't go to work like this," Zach gestured.

"Don't you wear an apron?" Jared responded coyly. "Just get in there and put it on before anyone sees."

Zach liked the idea. He knew how smart Jared was and saw it as a better alternative than digging into his dirty laundry hamper and digging out one of his shirts covered in coffee and pit stains, or both.

Zach walked over to Jared and gave him a playful kiss on the head, and belly bumped his head in the process unintentionally. "This is why you're the smart one," Zach said with a cheesy grin. He left the apartment knowing he was late and tried his best to not draw any extra attention to his button-less shirt.

A few minutes and a few glares later and he's at the coffee shop where he tries to cross his arms to hide the hole and get his apron on. He slides past one of his coworker, ties the apron and lets out a sigh of relief which may definitely have caused another button to come off, but at least know he was covered.

"Hey Zach," he heard and turned around to see...
12123.title: After few weeks at the new job.

121231.content:
"Can I see you in my office for a second?" asked April. Zach took a deep breath, immediately regretting it as he knew once he breathed out his shirt would be put under further strain. Zach slowly followed April, running through his mind what could possibly be the reason why he could be getting fired so quickly. Maybe it was the few pastries he ate. Maybe it was the many pastries he ate.

Zach sat in the chair opposite of April, with his new gut profoundly sitting in his lap, even with an apron on. "Zach, our beloved baker Terry has found it time to retire after working with us for years. And as sad as I am to see him go, we need a replacement quick. I figured that you'd be the perfect candidate! Terry will train you of course!"

Zach was perplexed! He thought for sure he'd be fired, not promoted. Zach considered the options in his head. He wasn't all that good with the coffee machine, and he hated dealing with snobby customers. Then again, as his roommates constantly reminded him, he didn't need to be around more pastries.

"I'll take it!" Zach said excitedly. April clapped her hands. "Great! You can go see Terry now!"

Zach had met Terry before, but only through the window of the kitchen inside the coffee shop. He made his way to the back. "Hey how are ya, so you're the lad that they've sent to replace me, eh?" Terry joked. Zach towered over Terry, who must've been 5'4 or 5'5.
"Well you can hand over that coffee apron, you won't be needing that anymore." Terry said. Zach slowly took off his apron, revealing now 3 buttons that had popped off his shirt. Zach blushed in embarrassment. .

"Ah, I see the pastries have already made their way to your gut since working here. Trust me, they'll do it to you!" Terry joked, patting his own sizeable gut.

Terry handed Zach a baker's coat to cover his hairy gut and the two got started. Zach liked this new work. Although challenging to remember, the work seemed easy. They had finished baking the batch around 2. The coffee shop closes at 3.

"Now, whatever is not sold by the end of the day, we get to keep, because it cannot be sold tomorrow. Almost as if on que, Zach's stomach rumbled. He just now realized he hadn't eaten today. "And whenever you're hungry, no one's gonna stop you from eating your own work!" Terry said, picking up a cookie and walking away. Zach couldn't help himself, and shoved 4 cookies, 3 donuts, and a croissant into his mouth.

After showing Zach how to clean up, it was 3 o'clock, and there were too many leftovers to count. Terry handed Zach a dozen of what seemed like everything, and Zach made his way home with a box full of pastries. When Zach walked in,
121231.title: April, the manager

1212311.content:
Zach let out a sigh of relief when he saw no one else in the apartment. He knew his roommates would give him a hard time for bring home a huge box full of pastries, but after a long day at work, he deserved it. Zach took off his new uniform and sat on the couch. He opened up the box and started shoving food in his mouth, not even keeping track of what went in. Cookies, donuts, muffins, cupcakes, croissants, cake, and other sugary goods found their way into his mouth. There must have been a dozen or more of each. Zach was too focused on finishing the box before his roommates got home, as not to share the sugary delight. Zach's belly grew larger and larger, but he got hungrier and hungrier.

2 hours later, Zach finished the entire 3'x3' box of pastries. His stomach ballooned, sitting like a mountain ontop of Zach who was now laying down. Zach laid on the couch, bare chested with sugar over his body, sweatpants stretched to the brim, and he drifted off to a deep nap for the day, dreaming of what else he could bake the next day.

When he woke up...
1212311.title: He was alone

12123112.content:
"So what about....... holy fuck!" Jared cut himself off. Jared, Dean, and Alec filed into the room and saw Zach, looking as big as ever, shirtless spread across the couch. His hairy stomach was topped with sugar, and his sweatpants were beginning to tear. Jared picked up the empty box and saw the name of the coffee shop on top, surprised they carried boxes this big.

"Hes getting gigantic." Dean said, feeling sorry for his younger brother.
"He barely fits on the couch anymore" added Alec.
"Remember when he used to be quarterback? Now he looks like he could be the biggest linebacker."

Zach was slowly coming to from his food coma, aroused by the aromas of the 2 large pizzas the guys brought home.

"Hey guys, you brought pizza?" Zach asked, gluttonously. Jared rolled his eyes.
"Bro, you're getting massive!" Dean said.
"It's only a few pounds..." Zach said.
"I think it's time we see the damage." Jared said, and motioned towards the scale in the bathroom. Everyone walked towards it, but Zach couldn't help but to grab a slice of pizza on his way in.

Zach slowly placed his big feet on the scale, and it read....
12123112.title: Zach's roommates got home

121231122.content:
"Holy shit, bro. Two thirty three?" Dean said, looking down at the scale as his shirtless brother stood upon it.

"Damn man, you're bigger than me," Alec said smacking his bulk.

Zach shrugged and stepped off the scale. The truth is he didn't really mind it. So he gained a few pounds and the guys gave him a hard time about it. If he wanted to start working out like Dean and drop the weight he could. He tried to make light of it all and make it into a joke, as one does.

"Guess that means I'm the big man in the apartment now, huh?" Zach replied to Alec, and stood beside him.

"Sure, big man," he said and gave Zach's belly a squeeze.

Dean was not the jokester Zach was, and was genuinely concerned for his brother. He watched Zach grab another slice of pizza, open a beer, and sit back on the couch.

"Zach, let's get serious for a minute. You've gained 30 pounds since you moved here, that's not healthy," he said sitting across from him.

Zach took a sip of his beer, "I'm fine dude. Relax!"

"Why don't you start coming to the gym with me in the mornings?" Dean said in a serious tone.

Zach laughed. "No way dude, not happening." He burped and finished his beer, and started to head back to the kitchen for another.

"So what, you're going to just keep this up and keep getting bigger?" Dean replied with a bit of snark.

"I've got everything under control dude," Zach said. "Plus I'm still the better looking brother," he joked and gave a smile as he rubbed his growing hairy gut for emphasis.

"Well, mom and dad are coming to the city for dinner next week. I'll let them lecture you. They're going to be shocked when they see how big you've gotten. All I can say is they better not blame this on me enabling you," Dean said and let out a sigh.

Zach just rolled his eyes and grabbed more pizza. He thought about the week ahead.
121231122.title: 223 (33 lb gain)

choices: Alec's clothes are tight on Zach
Alec's clothes fit perfectly on Zach
Forget it, he'd rather wear his own clothes
1212311222.content:
Another week and another five to ten pounds, Dean estimated, had gone by before Dean and Zach had dinner with their folks. They lived in New Jersey where the boys grew up, so it wasn't uncommon for their parents to come into the city or for the boys to head out to Jersey to spend the weekend at their family home. Zach had been living there after college and before moving in with Dean, so he hadn't really made it a priority to see his parents. The last time Dean went home to visit, Zach stayed in the city and partied instead of going home. Dean realized his parents hadn't seen Zach since he moved into the city two months ago. He worried they were going to be shocked at the sight of his (not so) little brother.

The thought of this all didn't phase Zach in the same way that Dean did. Dean was the anxious one, Zach was the relaxed one, and it showed. Dean stuck to his gym regime and was in terrific shape. Zach on the other hand, had been stuffing himself with pastries, beer, and junk food for weeks, and it showed.

Dean had arrived home from work to change and shower before dinner. Zach had finished up work at the coffee shop at three and was napping at the apartment when Dean arrived. He walked over to Zach's room, the door was open and he was snoring. As always he was shirtless, large hairy dome of a gut rising and falling as he breathed in and out.

"Yo Zachy, get up. Dinner is in an hour," Dean said from outside the door, loud enough to get Zach up.

Zach groaned in response. After a quick shower, Dean got into more casual clothes and checked on Zach. He was in the kitchen eating some leftover Chinese food, in his underwear.

"What the fuck dude? We're going to dinner in twenty minutes. Why are you eating and why are you not dressed?" Dean said. "Also that's Alec's food."

Zach sighed and finished what he was eating. He went to his room to change. Unsurprisingly, both his pants and his t-shirt left little to the imagination. Dean had been telling him he needed new clothes after more than one incident with Zach's clothes ripping over his growing torso.

Dean couldn't help but almost laugh. His "little" brother looked like a stuffed sausage in t-shirt and nearly painted-on jeans. He didn't understand how it didn't bother Zach to be dressed like that. He wondered if maybe he didn't even notice how large his tight clothes made him look.

"You really need to go shopping for some new clothes," he urged for what felt like the fiftieth time.

"I've been wearing some of Alec's stuff. Most of it fits just fine," Zach replied.

"Why don't you put on something of his now? You don't want to bust out of your shirt in front of mom and dad," Dean said watching the seems on Zach's shirt strain with all of their might.

"Fine," Zach said in response. He didn't really feel like being lectured by his parents about his weight. Dean was already doing that enough so wearing Alec's clothes might actually be a good idea.
1212311222.title: Dinner with the folks

12123112221.content:
Zach jumped up and down in his bedroom trying to get Alec's jeans to fit. Hovering above 230 lbs now, he saw that wasn't a good idea as he thought, seeing the whole room shake. Knowing that the jeans couldn't get past his larger butt and seeing that the buttons could never get around his fattened waist and belly, he gave up on the jeans. Zach was confused. He normally fit in Alec's clothes just fine. Then again, he normally wore Alec's sweatpants and sweatshirts, and he did add a little too much butter to the not-so-unintentional full sized extra cake he made today. Zach decided that wearing Alec's sweatpants would have to do.

When he left his room, Dean rolled his eyes. "Zach! You can't wear sweatpants and a sweatshirt to dinner with mom and dad!" Dean exclaimed.
"They're all that fit" Zach said, grabbing a donut from the counter. All Dean could do is sigh - besides maybe the clothes could hide Zach's newfound heft. The two made their way to dinner.

Zach and Dean's parents were so excited to see their kids they gave them a big hug, barely noticing Zach's weight gain. Zach immediately felt underdressed in the fancy restaurant, seeing button up shirts and dress pants on everyone.

Zach and Dean's dad was tall like his children, but not as tall as Zach. Their dad carried some heft but nothing surprising with his age. Their mom was the same, not too big not too small. But compared to everyone, Zach was huge. Broad, tall, and fat, even the sweatshirt couldn't hide these facts. Regardless, the four happily sat down to a table for dinner.

Dean and his dad ordered a 12 oz steak, feeling rather hungry; and their mom ordered a salad. Zach surprised everyone - especially Dean who had known how much Zach had already eaten today - when he ordered a 25oz porterhouse steak. "You sure you can finish that, son?" Dad asked. "Yep, and I'll finish whatever you can't either!" Zach joked.

The family caught up with each other while waiting for food - Zach eating a noticeable majority of the bread - and once the food came, Zach's steak looked gigantic. Sure, Dean and dad's were large too, but Zach's steak looked the size of Dean. Zach quickly ate away at his steak. Much to the awe of his entire family, he ate the entire thing, the side of fries, as well as the last few bites of Dean's steak, and even a slice of chocolate cake for dessert.

Zach felt the sides of Alec's sweatpants cut into his fattened waist. The sweatshirt exposed Zach's happy trail slightly, as the sweatshirt couldn't cover all of Zach and his gut. Zach's mom and dad...
12123112221.title: Alec's clothes are tight on Zach

121231122211.content:
"Zach, your shirt," his mother said, trying to discreetly let him know his belly was hanging out. His mother gave his father a look. Zach didn't quite notice but Dean sure did.

"Son. We can't help but notice that you've... put on a few pounds," Zach's father said, putting his hand on his shoulder. "Is everything alright?"

"I'm fine," Zach said having tugged down on his shirt to cover his expanding mass.

"You devoured a lot of food tonight, Zach. We're just worried about you," his mother said earnestly. Dean just looked on until his parents turned their attention to him.

"And Dean, how could you let your little brother get so out of shape? Why haven't you been taking him to the gym with you?" his father piped back.

"What? Why am I at fault here? It's not my fault Zach can't stop shoveling food into his fat face," Dean said plainly.

"Enough you guys. I've got it all under control. And plus, I'm not even that big," Zach said. Almost on queue, he heard a rip in Alec's sweatpants that was unmistakeable.

"You're in denial, Zach. You look 30 pounds heavier than when you moved here. Sorry to be so blunt but it's true," Zach's father said.

He continued. "With all that said, we think that you should..."
121231122211.title: mention their son's weight gain

choices: Dean works to fatten Zach even more
121231122212.content:
They said nothing. Dean sat there, perplexed. How did they not notice what a colossal fatass Zach had become? It brought him back to their childhood. Dean was always the do-gooder and was pressured immensely to get good grades and work hard, while Zach could be a lazy slob and get away with everything because he was the baby.

As they finished up dinner and stood up, Zach's belly was visibly hanging out of Alec's sweatshirt. He didn't even bother to tug it down.

"We're so proud of you for getting a job, Zachy," Mrs. Campbell said as she gave her son a big hug.

Dean was mindblown. It wasn't like it was a career, he was pouring coffee and eating pastries all day.

"You've made in the big city, big man," Mr. Campbell said hugging Zach as Dean watched on, getting more and more irritated.

Mom and Dad gave their hugs to Dean as well, said their goodbyes and that was that. Dean and Zach headed to a bar to have a beer or two after even though Dean was seething, he was good at not showing it.

"And you thought they were going to say I was fat? I told you it wasn't that bad bro," Zach said, giving a heavy slap to his big brother on his shoulder as he took a swig of his beer.

Dean was off in space, still wondering how his parents didn't notice or say anything about his very big little brother. After lecturing Zach about his weight for weeks, his parents didn't even bother to reinforce it? Fuck it, he thought, why even give a fuck about how fat his brother becomes, if his parents don't even give a shit.

"It's amazing how you get away with shit," Dean responded sipping on his own beer, as his brother ordered another. Dean rolled his eyes as this was on his tab, of course.

"I can't help it that I'm adorable," Zach said, with that shit-eating grin he always gave that seemed to charm everyone.

After another couple beers, Zach took off to get some late night munchies. Dean stayed at the bar where Jared met him. He felt free to vent to him. "It's unbelievable Jared. He just gets away with it all. He's living off of me essentially, working if you can call it that at a glorified Dunkin Donuts and they just give him everything he wants. He ate a shit ton at dinner tonight and not a peep from mom or dad," Dean rambled on.

"Maybe they didn't notice?" Jared said. He almost couldn't keep a straight face with the suggestion, considering how obvious it was that Zach had quite literally blown up.

I could make them notice, Dean thought to himself.
121231122212.title: brush it off

1212311222121.content:
Dean always had the perfect body. Daily workouts, 3 trips to the gym a week, and a strict diet gave him muscles that busted out of every shirt. Dean was happy with his body, and disgusted by Zach's. How could he sit around all day, and no one would say anything? If he wants to be fat, Dean thought, then I'll make him fat.

When Dean got up the next day, he saw Zach still sleeping. Dean decided to take the day off. He woke up his brother for another fattening day at work. Soon, everyone was out of the apartment, and Dean would set his plan in motion. He through out any healthy food in the apartment. He replaced it all with junk food and fast food, all within reach of Zach. He bought a minifridge and placed it in Zach's room, and filled it with beer and sweets. Soon, all the cabinets were spilling out with unhealthy food. Dean knew whatever was in front of Zach, he'd eat. He'd heard him rummaging through the kitchen late at night, and failing to find a snack as he'd eaten them all the day before. He wouldn't let that happen anymore.

Around 3, Zach came in carrying a box almost the size of a yoga ball. "What's that?" Dean asked.
"Oh, we were extra slow today, and I accidentally made an extra few batches, so I brought them home!" Zach said, placing the box down and grabbing a cookie from inside. Dean was in shock. He looked into the box and it was full of dessert. Now was time to set his last part of the plan in motion.

"Hey Zach, I just wanted to say sorry about bugging you about your weight. I just want whats best for you. If you're okay with gaining a few pounds, then thats fine." Dean said.
"Thanks bro, that means a lot". Zach muffled, with a whole donut in his mouth.
"I wanted to make it up to you, so I made you a milkshake!" Dean said, handing Zach the tall glass. Sure, there was milk and ice cream inside, but heavy cream, weight gain powder, and appetite enhancers were a bit of a unique addition. Zach's eyes lit up, and he drank the whole thing, it was delicious!

"That milkshake is actually good for you, I added some vitamins so that even if you gain weight, there won't be any health complications. Think of it as our compromise!" Dean said. "And if you ever want one, I'll make it straight away!" Dean said.
"Thanks, I'll have another then!" Zach said. Dean blended away, and handed Zach another glass between mouthfuls.

In a few weeks, Dean's plan is...
1212311222121.title: Dean works to fatten Zach even more

12123112221211.content:
RIIIIIIP.

It was becoming an all too familiar sound to Zach. Shirts, pants, underwear, sweats: you name it, it was no match for the growing bulk that was Zach Prescott. With his own efforts, combined with Dean's plans, he had no trouble expanding in all directions.

Zach was attempting to get ready to head to a house party with his roommates and other friends. Emphasis on the word attempting as he had exhausted most options for what to wear.

Dean, Alec and Jared were in the living room sipping beers to pre-game as they awaited their younger, larger roommate. Zach had long since outgrown Alec's clothes which were the biggest in the apartment. Fortunately, he had some clothes Dean had gotten him that had a little extra room, or used to anyways. Dean didn't want Zach to know quite how large he was, so he would replace his clothes to try and keep him in the dark. Zach may have been a bit slow but even he knew that his waistline was well past where it was even just a month ago.

"He's got to be close to 300, dude," Alec commented hearing Zach struggle to squeeze into something.

"Close to? I feel like he's well past it," Jared snickered.

"No way, he's gotten huge but there's no way he's put on 75 pounds in a month," Dean replied, keeping the guys from exaggerating too much. He was enjoying it however, after all, much of it was his doing. He felt proud for having had a role in enabling Zach's slobbish behavior.

"Alright fellas, get me a beer to shotgun. I'm ready to go," Zach shouted as he came from his room to the living room where the rests of his roommates sat.

Zach looked like a human sausage squeezed into a pair of shorts and a t-shirt that maybe fit him thirty pounds ago, and even then it was probably a stretch. His hairy belly was hanging out of the front of his shirt.

Jared just laughed. "You're going to the party. Like that?" he said.

"What do you mean? I look good," Zach said. He put a backwards baseball cap and flashed a smile. He stood in front of where they sat on the couches as if to show off.

Alec was sitting in front of Zach and reached out and grabbed his belly. "You're not feeling a bit of a breeze, bro?"

Zach pulled down at his shirt in response. "The shirt fits fine, man. Don't worry about it."

"Tell that to your man tits that are nearly busting out of there," Jared said, cackling. He sipped on his beer.

Zach appeared unphased. He grabbed his third beer in what seemed like five minutes.

"Geez dude, slow down," Dean said, eyeing his brother's drinking.

"I'm catching up with y'all," Zach said in response. "Anyways let's get out of here," he said as he downed another beer and headed for the door.

The three others got up and headed off to the party. When they arrived the four of them were greeted by all of their friends. The party was at a house with a large backyard. It was rare to have that kind of space but it was pretty deep in Brooklyn, the guys thought.

"Fellas, nice to see you!" one of the guys throwing the party, Carlos said as he greeted the roommates. He was a friend of Dean's from growing up. Carlos went down the line greeting the guys until he came to Zach. Carlos had known Zach from when he was little and he couldn't believe the behemoth that stood before him.

14.content:
"Quittin' time?" Alec asked his buddy as he wiped sweat from his brow. It was a hot September day in Brooklyn, almost 5:00. Alec and his construction buddy Joey were finishing their work for the day.

"Yeah, we better," Joey gestured over towards an older gentleman about sixty feet away. "Before the boss man comes by."

"Happy hour?" Alec smiled as he moved a few boxed around. He knew that Joey was going to agree to it.

"Obviously," Joey quipped, patting Alec on his sweat-soaked shoulder.

Alec and Joey had been working construction together on the job site for almost three months. Ever since he'd joined the team, Joey had become Alec's little buddy, emphasis on the word little. Alec was a pretty big dude, standing at 6'6" and had a bit of bulk to him. In contrast, Joey was a much smaller and slimmer 5'6". Despite the size disparity, Joey and Alec got along swimmingly since the day the met. Joey was only 23 and Alec showed him the ropes around the construction site and the two had become fast friends. It had become a routine for the two of them to hit up happy hour once their shift was done.

The unlikely pair headed to their lockers to change out of their sweaty clothes. Alec was drenched, his shirt underneath his vest was almost transparent, clinging to his skin. He was carrying about 215 pounds on his large frame, in fairness. Alec removed his tight and wet shirt, before opening his locker. Alec was a confident guy, not shy about walking around shirtless or even pantless at times.

Joey looked over at Alec and smiled. The two of them were so opposite, he thought.

"Ready for bottomless wings, bro?" Alec smacked his wet hairy stomach in excitement. Joey just smiled and gave him a thumbs up as he fumbled with his shirt.

Joey was much shier than Alec about his body, though he had no reason to be. He was a trim 155 pounds which was perfectly average for his height. He had a bit of lean muscle but was far and away the smallest guy at the construction site. Joey wasn't even really sure how he ended up there considering he wasn't exactly your big, strong guy like his buddy Alec. Despite that Joey was a hard worker and could actually do more than most expected from him. Some of the guys would give him a hard time about his size, even Alec. It didn't bother him when Alec made comments though because they were legitimate friends.

"I'll try to keep up with you," Joey replied as he watched Alec squeeze into a fairly tight tank top, his furry belly peering out of the bottom before he tugged it down.

Alec laughed. He knew that was not going to happen, but he liked trying to push Joey outside of his comfort zone.

Joey quickly slid into his clean shirt. He was a hairy Italian dude, and was not really a confident person, so he changed in a much more subdued way than his big, confident buddy Alec. He even dressed more conservatively.

A few of the other guys walked into the locker room as Joey and Alec headed to their happy hour spot. "Goin' to McNulty's?" one of the bigger guys asked as he saw them headed out. It was well known that was Alec's favorite post-work spot due to the cheap beer and the bottomless wing specials for happy hour. Alec would always try to get out of work early to catch it when he could.

"You know it," Alec replied. Joey just smiled with his mouth closed. Everyone at the site respected Alec, perhaps they were intimidated by him, but Joey often felt put down or ignored. He didn't let it get to him, and Alec always made him feel better about it. He thought that if someone was loved as Alec was his closest friend that everyone else would follow suit and think he was just as cool.

"Catch you later, big guy," one of them said to Alec as he punched him on the shoulder. "You too, little guy. Almost couldn't see you back there", he added as he saw Joey from behind Alec. Joey suspected he was just messing around.

At the bar, Alec ordered his usual beer of choice along with the bottomless wings. He wasted no time digging in. Joey tried to keep up but would almost always end up stopping several rounds before Alec. He also took his time more with his beer while Alec really packed it in.

"Try to keep up with me tonight, bud," Alec said, playfully nudging Joey beside him. Joey knew it was unrealistic but something in him really wanted to impress and make Alec happy.

"I'll see what I can do," Joey said as he started eating and drinking at a more Alec-like pace.

What happens?

"I'm done, bro," Joey grunted. He looked almost sick after eating seven plates of wings and drinking six beers. Alec gave a disapproving look but put his big arm around his friend.

Plus, Joey had always been the little guy. He was tired of it. Maybe getting bigger was his chance to see what life was like on the other side. The whole idea of it excited him, but it was as if he didn't know he even wanted it until it was suggested.

Joey had seen tons of weight gain power in gyms and nutrition stores, but this looked entirely different from what he'd seen before. Alec handed Joey the bottle. It was surprisingly small compared to products he'd seen before.

"Do you... use this?" Joey asked innocently.

"Nah, no need. I'm just big naturally," he said, petting his furry and firm gut which he'd lifted up his shirt to expose. "If I took that stuff I'd be as big as a house."

"So why do you have it?" Joey asked, wondering why his friend was so eager and willing to help him.

"My friend works at a lab and has given me some products he's working on. So it's sort of experimental. I figured maybe it would be something that interested you. I know you hate being the little guy around the site," Alec said earnestly, patting his little buddy on the shoulder.

Joey just smiled sweetly. Alec was a good friend, he thought. He didn't even need to tell him about what things he wanted or needed, he just knew. Of course it couldn't have been hard to tell, with Joey relentlessly being teased for his size. Most of the guys there wonder why he even works at a construction site at a measly 5'6" and maybe 150 pounds. Most of the guys were at least 30 pounds bigger and Joey had nearly 75 pounds on him.

"So, take some," Alec urged.

Joey shrugged his shoulders in response. He looked down at the bottle, reading the dosage carefully.

"Are there side effects?" Joey asked.

"Fuck if I know dude," Alec said. "You gotta take risks sometimes, bro," he smiled and leaned back in his chair, looking very relaxed as Joey eyed the bottle and opened it up.

14113.content:
The card said "Madame Marie" and gave an address in the city. Joey just looked it and it looked back to Alec, wondering if he would explain at all what it was.

"Just go there when you've got some time. Explain what it is you want, and she'll sort you out," Alec said, delivering it like some sort of Italian mafia boss. To be honest, he sort of looked like one too.

"Oh... okay," Joey struggled to respond. He thought this all sounded a bit strange but the earnestness in Alec's eyes won him over. He seemed to not be able to say no to anything that Alec asked of him.

"Don't be nervous little guy. You're never going to be a big man without some confidence and swagger like your boy," Alec laughed and patted his belly.

So Joey took the card with him and with his next day off, he decided to head to this mysterious place. It was a seemingly minimalistic storefront, he saw nobody around the shop when he walked in. It looked less like a psychic shop than he expected. As he entered further he only saw a bell on the counter, he assumed to ring for any attention. He nervously approached the bell and gave it a ding.

Suddenly a woman appeared from the back of the store. Marie, he assumed.

"How can I help you dear?" the woman said as she approached. She was in her fifties, Joey assumed, and sort of attractive for her age. She definitely gave off the vibe of some sort of mystic or witch, which made Joey a bit nervous.

"Um, I'm not sure," Joey said, looking away from Marie.

"Nonsense. Let me look into your eyes, dear. I will be able to tell what you seek," Marie said.

Joey took his averted gaze and looked at Marie in her deep blue eyes.

"Ahh, I see. I know what it is you want. Don't be ashamed dear," Marie said in her soothing voice.

Joey just continued to look into her eyes. He felt almost hypnotized by her gaze as she stared back into his green eyes. She put her hands on his face, feeling his slight stubble.

"I will make your wish a reality. You wish..."

141131.content:
"You wish to grow, my dear," Marie stated, matter-of-factly.

"Yes," Joey replied, stuttering a bit to get the words out. He somehow felt a weight lifted, knowing he could be honest with himself about this.

"Very well, I can make your wish a reality," Marie said, smiling.

"How?" Joey asked, perplexed and nervous about what might happen next.

"The process is unimportant. What is important is that you be honest with yourself and the person you want to become," Marie said. "I want to visualize how you'd like yourself to look and give me your hands."

Joey put his hands out, and Marie placed what felt like a crystal into his hands. "Grasp that tightly," Marie stated.

Marie whispered some incantations and the crystal appeared to glow slightly. Joey couldn't tell as his hands were clasped around the crystal but he was sure he felt something - a light, a vibe, a sense - that the crystal did have some sort of energy. He did as he was told, however, as Marie finished her quiet chants.

"That is it," Marie said succinctly, retrieving the crystal from Joey.

"So what now?" Joey said, still perplexed. He itched his light brown spiky hair in bemusement.

"You will get what it is you seek, darling," Marie said, confidently. She put her hand on his shoulder assuringly.

"Do I... pay you for this?" Joey wondered. His earnest green eyes looking at the middle-aged mystic intently.

"You will. The matter of payment will be dealt with when you get what you want. Come back to me when you feel you've been fulfilled," Marie said. "I assure you, you will be."

"Alright. Um, thank you," Joey replied. He didn't exactly know what to do so he just shook her hand and left. She smirked as he left the shop.

Joey left the store, grabbed something to eat and headed back to his apartment. He got into his underwear and slid underneath the covers. He went to bed wondering if seeing Madame Marie was a waste of time or if he'd actually get what it is he desired. He drifted off to sleep wondering what would come.

1411312.content:
The next few days go by without much change. Joey seemed to think that the wish was bogus as he saw nothing really change in his life. Joey looked at himself in the mirror as he did most days, saw the short dirty-brown haired, green eyed, clean cut guy staring back. He had a small happy trail on his skinny stomach that he rubbed.

"Oh well," he said to himself looking in the mirror and seeing no real difference from the day before. He never had much faith in this magical wish bullshit anyways.

He continued to work and saw Alec there and smiled. "How's it goin' little buddy?" Alec asked kindly, not knowing how much those words actually stung. Joey was always the little guy, it's why he was compelled to wish to grow. But he figured that was all for nothing now. At least he hadn't needed to pay the Madame Marie, he thought.

"All is good, man," he replied back to Alec, who gave him a playful slap on the back. Alec didn't know his own strength, it was always almost too much for Joey's smaller stature to handle. Joey braced himself for the days work and went about his business. They went about their typical day like usual: work out in the sun, head to the bar for food and drinks, and repeat the next workday. Joey didn't have a particularly interesting weekend either. Unfortunately for him he had obnoxious roommates, and often avoided his common area from having to deal with them. Both were bigger jock type guys, and they treated Joey like a little brother, like most people in his life.

It wouldn't be until the next week when Joey considered that maybe his wish was coming true. He woke up on a Monday morning, not having put on his work clothes in days, and he noticed that they were a little tight. Joey had almost completely forgotten about his encounter with Madame Marie, and shrugged off the tight pants as being due to the shitty washer in the basement shrinking his stuff. It wasn't until he sat down to post-work drinks with Alec, that his slight growth was noticed. He sipped on his beer and Alec glanced down at his little buddy. He gave his stomach a pinch. "Is this what I think it is?" Alec joked with Joey.

Joey was a little squeamish when it came to touch but from Alec, it felt different. Joey looked down at his stomach and noticed a tiny little roll. "Oh shit," he said aloud.

"Looking good, little buddy. It suits you," Alec said with a smile as he sipped on his own beer. An order of wings and some burgers came the boys way and both dove in. Alec even remarked that Joey was eating more than usual.

"It's like you're going through puberty or something," Alec joked with his friend. "Maybe you'll finally have a growthspurt." Joey knew Alec was being playful, and to him Alec could do no wrong but it was something irritating to him that he was always picked on about his size, even by one of his best friends. "Guess so," Joey said chomping on some fries. With Alec's encouragement he almost kept up with Alec, having finished off several pitchers of beer, wings, a burger, and some fries. His bloated stomach spoke for itself after the night was over.

The weeks went on and Joey slowly but surely began to grow. It wasn't enough for anyone to notice that it was anything but natural, but the more he began to grow, so did his appetite. It had been two weeks and Joey had put on 15 pounds. He was still a slim guy, just with a little bit of a paunch to him. He examined himself in the mirror as he'd been doing more frequently recently and pinched his little love handles. "What are you doing in there?" yelled one of his roommates as he knocked on the door. "I gotta shower, baby Joey!" Joey just rolled his eyes, he hated that nickname from his roommate Shawn.
